author: Giordan Diodato

text: ah the memories. this game came with our used nes at a yardsale and the battery was dead so we couldnt save any progress if it was powered off. on top of that, our parents never let us play more than a couple hours at a time, and insisted on us turning the system off. despite this, we were pretty determined and basically got in the habit of speed running whatever we'd already figured out. one day, a glitch caused a bugged save file to appear that had the hammer and a weird random assortment of other items unlocked. this allowed us to bypass a large section that we'd really been struggling with and we were determined not to miss out on this opportunity. me and my brothers conspired to keep the game on for probably a week or two, at least, as we tried to complete the game, convincing our parents that the system was turned off by blocking the light with something and disconnecting the video cables. unfortunately our plot was eventually foiled by a power flash during a bad storm. we never got that bugged save file to appear again and we never did beat the game. lol, it all seams so ridiculous now :D (but i did eventually go back and beat the game a few years ago on an emulator)
author: Speedj2

text: Man this sure does take me back. What a great time to be a kid.I remember my grandmother and anuts use to yell at me to the top of there lungs saying stop blowing into that game your going to get a headache. Needless to say I think we all had a headache at the end of the day only difference was was that i had a smile on my face great times.

author: Tenchi Patterson

text:
I just watched a video about the history of this theme song. Apparently the title theme originally was not going to be an original piece, but a piece from a composer (idk if that's the word) from many years ago. Non-original pieces only become available for public use in Japan 50 years after the  creator dies. Koji Kondo assumed 50 years had pieced as it was so old, but only 49 years had passed... He figured this out so last minute that he composed this theme song in one night by pulling an all nighter.


Edit: Nope I'm dumb

author: CHINKERATOR

text: Not really a blemish considering that there were only two games at the time, this and the original.  More like differently colored half.  In an alternate universe Miyamoto and his crew expand the Zelda universe from Zelda 2, making it more like an action RPG, instead of the item-finding Indiana Jones/James Bond/Batman Zelda we have today.  A Link to the Past and Link's Awakening solidified the series as an item-based romp, not an ability based adventure.
author: Gamebox27

text: Yep.  The masks are great, I especially like shape-shifting ones.  I really don't think there has been a bad Zelda (CD-I games don't exist...), however I am having troubles getting into Skyward Sword with the motion controls (seems like a great game though).  Plus games like Skyrim go where Zelda should have gone, and did start to go with Zelda II.  Imagine a fully explorable Hyrule (not just the area under Death Mountain's shadow) in the format of Skyrim.  Now THAT would be a godlike Zelda.
